content: Jets coach Aaron Glenn on Tuesday sounded both amused and annoyed by the reaction to quarterback Justin Fields' two preseason performances.

title: Steelers' Heyward practices despite stalemate
content: Cameron Heyward was in uniform and participating with the Steelers in practice, but a source told ESPN that there hasn't been any movement on his request for a renegotiated contract.

content: Two monorail trains broke down in Mumbai this evening amid heavy rain, stranding hundreds of passengers.

title: Mumbai Rain Highlights: All Passengers Rescued From Stranded Monorail, Red Alert Tomorrow
content: Mumbai Rains LIVE News: Heavy rainfall led to waterlogging on roads, and delayed flights and trains, with a red alert in place till Wednesday.

title: Google Fined $36 Million Over Anti-Competitive Deals With Australia Telcos
content: Google has agreed to pay a Aus$55 million (US$36 million) penalty for striking "anti-competitive" deals to pre-install only its own search engine on Android mobile phones sold by two leading Australian telecoms firms.

title: State Directed To Provide Certificates With Changed Name, Gender To Transwoman
content: The Manipur High Court has directed the state educational department to immediately issue fresh academic certificates reflecting the new name and gender identity of transwoman doctor Beoncy Laishram.

title: Sikkim University Student Sparks Row With 'Nepali' Remark, Taken Into Custody
content: A major controversy has erupted on the campus of Sikkim University in Gangtok over alleged derogatory remarks against the Nepali community and language by a student from Uttar Pradesh in a department WhatsApp group.

title: Brazil Asks Meta To Remove Chatbots That 'Eroticise' Children
content: Brazil's government has asked US technology giant Meta to rid its platforms of chatbots that mimic children and can make sexually suggestive remarks, the attorney general's office (AGU) announced Monday.

title: Trump Says Putin 'Tired' Of War, But Possible He Doesn't Want To Make Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he hoped Vladimir Putin was going to "be good" and move forward toward ending the war in Ukraine, but conceded it was possible the Russian president doesn't want to make a deal.

title: As Rain Continues To Cause Floods, Northern China Deaths Rise To 13
content: At least three more people have died in heavy rains in northern China, state media said on Tuesday, taking to 13 the death toll in recent storms across the region, with five still missing and no let-up in rain forecast.

title: Italy's Ventina Glacier Has Melted Beyond On-Site Monitoring: Geologists
content: Italy's Ventina glacier, one of the biggest in northern Lombardy, has melted so much due to climate change that geologists can no longer measure it the way they have for the past 130 years.

title: Netanyahu Slams Macron For Fuelling 'Antisemitic Fire'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu upbraided President Emmanuel Macron in a letter seen by AFP on Tuesday, blaming the French leader's move to recognise a Palestinian state for fuelling antisemitism.

title: Explained: Does Trump Have Power To Ban Mail-In Ballots In US Elections?
content: US President Donald Trump wants to ban mail-in ballots in federal elections, a form of voting popular with many Americans.

title: Norway's Royals To Continue Duties Amid Stepson's Rape Trial: Crown Prince Haakon
content: Norway's Crown Prince Haakon said on Tuesday the royal family would continue to carry out official duties while his stepson stands trial next year, accused of rape, adding that this is a challenging time for everyone involved.

title: US Pediatricians' New Covid-19 Shot Recommendations Differ From CDC Advice
content: For the first time in 30 years, the American Academy of Pediatrics is substantially diverging from US government vaccine recommendations.

title: Zelensky Gifts Trump Golf Club Of Ukrainian Soldier "Who Lost His Leg During Russia's Invasion"
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky gave US counterpart Donald Trump a golf club during his visit to Washington this week that had belonged to a serviceman fighting Russia's invasion, Kyiv said Tuesday.

title: China To Showcase 'Unrivalled' Extra Large New Drone Submarines: Report
content: China is preparing to showcase a new generation of unmanned underwater vehicles (UUVs) during a military parade in Beijing, underscoring its growing ability to contest US dominance at sea.

title: China To Showcase 'Unrivalled' Extra Large New Drone Submarines: Report
content: China is preparing to showcase a new generation of unmanned underwater vehicles (UUVs) during a military parade in Beijing, underscoring its growing ability to contest US dominance at sea.

title: Trump Says US Air Support Possible For Ukraine 'Security Guarantee'
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that US air support and European ground troops could be part of security guarantees for Ukraine, warning of a "rough" situation if talks between Moscow and Kyiv fail.

title: 383 Aid Workers Killed In 2024, Nearly Half In Gaza: UN
content: A record 383 aid workers were killed in global hotspots in 2024, nearly half of them in Gaza during the war between Israel and Hamas.

title: Wildfires Scorch Another 30,000 Hectares In Spain
content: Raging wildfires tore through an additional 30,000 hectares (74,000 acres) of western Spain in less than 24 hours, satellite data showed Tuesday, but cooler temperatures have raised hopes of containment.

content: Prakasam Barrage on the Krishna in NTR district and Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage on the Godavari in Rajamahendravaram reaches full capacity

content: Justice Tiruvarur Muthuswami Iyer was the first Indian to be appointed as a judge of the Madras High Court¬†in 1878

content: Union government maintains the decision is good for textile industries, will help stabilise cotton prices

content: The trial court in its judgment on May 13 ordered a total compensation of ‚Çπ85 lakh to seven out of the eight survivors in the case

content: A senior defence official terms the decision a major boost to government‚Äôs Make in India initiative; the aircraft will be manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited

content: The government had incorporated similar provisions in model byelaws for primary agricultural credit societies, the Cooperation Minister informed the Lok Sabha in a written reply

content: More than 550 pictures from across the country were submitted in the photography contest conducted by APPJA and 50 of them were selected for various prizes, says CR Media Academy chairman

title: Bill for simultaneous elections gives unfettered powers to Election Commission of India, says former CJI Sanjiv Khanna
content: Khanna gives his opinion to a parliamentary committee reviewing the Bill; he says the clause that allows ECI to postpone Assembly polls may result in Centre taking over the reins of the State government; four former CJIs too had flagged the issue; committee to meet economists now

content: Kanthapuram A.P. Aboobacker Musliar says he has contributed to Nimisha Priya‚Äôs reprieve from execution and the ball is now in Union government‚Äôs court to facilitate her release from Yemen prison.

content: ‚ÄòWhy should only one community do these kinds of jobs? Seeking job permanency is not agreeable to me. I have a second opinion on this issue,‚Äô says VCK leader

title: Private sector share in defence production hits record 22.56% in FY 2024-25
content: The contribution of private manufacturers has been steadily rising ever since the defence sector was opened to them in 2016-17

title: Updated Orange Book suggests curbs on new constructions in areas hit by landslips in 2018 Kerala floods
content: It replaces the landslide-susceptibility map of Kerala published by National Centre for Earth Science Studies with the landslide-hazard susceptibility mapping done by Geological Survey of India

content: TDP leader Nara Lokesh says there is ‚Äúno ambiguity ‚Äî only warmth, respect, and resolve. NDA stands united‚Äù

content: The two writ petitions, filed separately, were at scrutiny stage with the HC Registry and yet to be numbered

content: Party State secretary says M.R. Ajith Kumar‚Äôs ‚Äúmany actions were not advisable for a high-ranking officer of law‚Äù

title: Gandhi is of contemporary relevance, not just a memory: Sunil P. Ilayidam
content: Sessions on Gandhi, poetry, fiction, art, and gender mark the third day of the International Literature Festival

title: TTD takes stock of water availability in Tirumala ahead of annual Brahmotsavams
content: Calling for a detailed audit, TTD Additional Executive Officer Venkaiah Chowdary instructs officials to adopt conservation methods and rationalise water supply

content: Vangalapudi Anitha assures that strict action will also be taken against Srikanth‚Äôs fiance Aruna, who is viral on social media as ‚Äòlady don‚Äô for her alleged involvement in various crimes along with him

title: GBG Act 2024 better than BBMP Act 2020 but falls short, says Janaagraha
content: The draft of the GBG Bill, 2024, submitted by the Brand Bengaluru Committee scores 6.8, double that of the GBG Act brought in by the State government

title: Kerala to be declared fully digitally literate on Aug. 21
content: Minister for Local-Self Governments M.B. Rajesh says with the government making available most of its services online through the KSMART platform, it also aims to equip the entire population with the necessary digital skills to access these

title: Singareni becomes first coal PSU to take up exploration of gold, copper in country
content: CMD N. Balaram says it‚Äôs a ‚Äúgolden step‚Äù into exploration of critical minerals as the company wins bid to survey the metals in Devadurga, Karnataka

title: Bombay High Court functions only till 12.30 p.m. as Mumbai reels under rain
content: The India Meteorological Department issued a red alert for Mumbai and adjoining districts, forecasting extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places on August 19, 2025

title: Employment orders to be issued to 402 newly chosen SIs in 15-20 days
content: There was a dire shortage of SIs in the Home Department, and the government was keen to issue the employment order at the earliest: Home Minister

content:

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to set up IIM in Guwahati
content: This fulfils a long-standing demand in Assam, and provides the northeast with its second IIM after Shillong, says Education Minister; financial grant of ‚Çπ550 crore has been allocated for IIM Guwahati

title: NGO urges State to issue special health card for children with long-term illness
content: Thrissur-based NGO Solace, which supports over 7,000 critically ill children, appeals to the Chief Minister for urgent government action

title: Congress holds sticker campaign against ‚Äòvote theft‚Äô in Mysuru
content: KPCC spokesperson Lakshman alleges that BJP won the Lok Sabha elections of 2014, 2019, and 2024 through ‚Äòvote theft‚Äô

title: Karnataka Assembly session: Bill passed to regularise illegal buildings by levying penalty
content: Minister said building plan violations eligible for regulation is being raised from 5% to 15% and the Bill would allow¬†regularising buildings on 20x30 ft. and 30x40 ft. sites

title: RIC optics & oil leverage: Why is India calm amid trade storm
content: In response to Washington's oil-linked tariffs, India is strategically recalibrating its diplomatic approach. By reviving the Russia-India-China troika and engaging with both Moscow and Beijing, India signals its commitment to strategic autonomy. While prioritizing dialogue and exploring alternative markets, India aims to navigate the tariff challenges without compromising its long-term geopolitical interests.

title: Relief for CBI judge arrested by ED for corruption
content: Suspended CBI judge Sudhir Parmar, arrested in a money-laundering scam, has received a clean chit from a departmental committee, according to a report by inquiry officer Nirbhow Gill. The report, yet to be accepted by the High Court administration, could be a setback for the Haryana Vigilance Bureau. Parmar was suspended in April 2023 and jailed for nearly three months.

title: Acquisition of another 97 Tejas, 6 AEW&C aircraft gets CCS nod
content: India has approved the acquisition of 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighter jets and six AEW&C aircraft to bolster its air capabilities, collectively valued at Rs 85,500 crore. This move aims to address the combined threat from China and Pakistan, enhancing surveillance and combat readiness.

title: Pocso shouldn't be slapped on teens in love: SC
content: The Supreme Court of India has observed that love is not a crime, emphasizing that teenage romantic relationships should not be criminalized under the POCSO Act. Justices Nagarathna and Mahadevan highlighted the need to protect genuine affection between adolescents, cautioning against treating them as criminals when elopements occur.

title: 409mm in just 1.5 days: Mumbai crippled; 1 dead, 400 evacuated
content: Mumbai was severely disrupted by heavy rainfall on Tuesday, leading to the evacuation of 400 residents near the Mithi River and widespread waterlogging. Transportation was significantly affected, with flight diversions, train delays, and numerous bus route diversions. One person died from electrocution, and the city experienced its wettest August in five years, with continued showers expected.

title: Apple's big India move: All iPhone 17 models Made in India for US; Trump could be reason why
content: Apple is set to manufacture all iPhone 17 models in India before their September launch, a first for the company, including the Pro versions. This shift, driven by tariff concerns and geopolitical tensions, aims to fulfill most US iPhone demand from India. Tata Group will produce half of India's iPhones, boosting exports which reached $7.

title: Mother battles crocodile, saves 5-year-old son
content: In a harrowing incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, a five-year-old boy was snatched by a crocodile while playing near a drain. His mother, Maya, bravely fought the reptile, striking and clawing at it until it released her son. Both sustained injuries and are receiving medical treatment, while villagers demand increased safety measures to prevent future attacks.

title: ‚ÄòJust profiteering‚Äô: Trump admin's fresh salvo on India for Russian oil
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticized India's Russian oil purchases, deeming it "arbitrage" and accusing them of profiteering by reselling refined products.

title: Taylor Swift stays silent on Blake Lively; feud rumours swirl over new track
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively are reportedly not in contact. This follows Lively's involvement in a controversy. Sources say Swift has not spoken to Lively for months. Swift's new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' includes a track titled 'Ruin The Friendship.' Fans speculate it is about Lively. The album is set to release on October 3, 2025.

title: ‚ÄòRockets to Wall Street‚Äô: Musk‚Äôs teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: India-China ties: Both sides to explore 'early harvest' on boundary delimitation; expert group to be set up
content: India and China have agreed to enhance border dispute resolution efforts following talks between NSA Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi. An Expert Group will be established under the WMCC to expedite boundary delimitation. Both sides committed to a fair and mutually acceptable settlement, improved border management, and new mechanisms for de-escalation.

title: Apple iPhone 17 series set to launch soon: Check details
content: Apple is gearing up to launch its iPhone 17 series, featuring four models: the iPhone 17, 17 Air, 17 Pro, and Pro Max. The series promises significant design, performance, and camera upgrades. The iPhone 17 Air introduces an ultra-thin design, while the Pro models boast enhanced camera systems and processing power.

title: Overcrowding, power glitch: Why Mumbai monorail got stuck? Over 400 rescued
content: In Mumbai, a monorail carrying over 400 passengers broke down between stations due to overcrowding during torrential rains, leading to a three-hour stranding. Rescue operations were promptly initiated by BMC, fire department, and police, ensuring the safe evacuation of all passengers, with some taken to hospitals as a precaution.

title: Bodies of 2 flash flood victims recovered in Rajouri and Poonch; Army rescues civilians
content: Tragedy struck Jammu as the bodies of two flash flood victims, including a young girl, were recovered in Rajouri and Poonch. Swift action by the Army saved several individuals stranded on an island in the Poonch River. Authorities have issued warnings urging caution due to ongoing weather challenges in the border districts.

title: Tyson Bagent shocks Chicago as Bears tout NFL‚Äôs best QB duo
content: Tyson Bagent, the underdog quarterback, stole the show at Chicago Bears' preseason game. He threw for 205 yards and a touchdown. Bagent's performance highlighted his potential. Coach Ben Johnson praised his confidence and decision-making. Bagent's rise provides the Bears with valuable quarterback depth. His success has transformed him from a fan favorite to a legitimate threat.

title: Andy Roddick defends Iga Swiatek; calls out disrespect after Cincinnati win
content: Andy Roddick swiftly defended Iga Swiatek after a social media user questioned her relevance following her Cincinnati Open victory against Jasmine Paolini. Roddick's one-word response, "Yes," on an Instagram post celebrating Swiatek's win, garnered praise from tennis fans. This support follows Roddick's earlier defense of Swiatek during her 2024 doping controversy, highlighting his consistent admiration for the Polish star's talent.

title: French streamer Jean Pormanove dies at 46, fans outraged
content: French streamer Jean Pormanove, known for his extreme IRL broadcasts, tragically died at 46, sparking grief and outrage. His death followed a grueling Kick marathon, raising concerns about unsafe streaming culture. Fans are sharing disturbing clips, igniting debate on platform accountability and creator safety in the face of toxic content.

title: Now, flood of severed limbs spooks Chasoti
content: The devastating flash floods in Chasoti, Kishtwar, have claimed over 140 lives, with the confirmed death toll at 68 and 72 still missing. Rescue teams are now focused on recovering bodies and body parts. Doctors and villagers are shaken by the sheer number of severed limbs found.

title: Desmond Watson waits for clearance as Buccaneers hold rookie out until weight loss goal
content: Desmond Watson, the heaviest NFL player, is working to lose weight. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers rookie is currently sidelined. He joined the team in April 2025. Watson is collaborating with a nutritionist. He is doing conditioning in Florida's heat. Coach Todd Bowles wants him healthier. The team hopes to have a plan for Watson soon.

title: Doda admin limits Kailash Kund Yatra due to rough weather, cloudburst tragedies
content: Due to severe weather and recent cloudburst tragedies in Jammu and Kashmir, the Doda district administration has curtailed the Kailash Kund Yatra in Bhaderwah. The three-day pilgrimage, scheduled from August 20-22, will now be symbolic, prioritizing devotee safety. Women and children are restricted from participating. Pilgrims must carry valid ID, and the Chattergala route is off-limits.

title: Royal Navy gets its first Hindu chaplain
content: Bhanu Attri, raised in India and now residing in Essex, has made history as the Royal Navy's first Hindu chaplain. He recently graduated from Britannia Royal Naval College, marking a significant step towards religious diversity within the naval service.

title: UK: man convicted of shooting Kerala girl in head, permanently injuring her
content: Javon Riley has been convicted for his involvement in the shooting of a nine-year-old girl from Kerala in Dalston. The innocent victim was struck by a bullet during a gang-related attack on a Turkish restaurant, leaving her with permanent brain injuries.

title: Asia Cup snub: Shreyas Iyer given fresh backing - 'There is no doubt in my mind'
content: Despite Shreyas Iyer's strong IPL performance and upcoming Asia Cup, selectors omitted him from the squad. Irfan Pathan strongly believes Iyer will return to the T20 team and become a leader. Iyer's impressive post-T20 World Cup stats include 949 runs in 26 matches, averaging 49.94 with a 179.73 strike rate, highlighting his potential impact.

title: Indians on H-1B: Where will they go if they lose jobs in the US?
content: For Indian professionals on H-1B and L-1 visas, the American dream is increasingly uncertain. Visa restrictions, sudden policy shifts, and political rhetoric are reshaping career and life choices. A Blind poll shows 45% would return to India if laid off, drawn by family, cultural ties, and tech opportunities, while regulatory changes and professional risks continue to complicate long-term planning.

title: Ex-Panthers star urges Team Canada to join Crosby, McDavid at 4 Nations
content: Brandon Montour aims for a spot on Team Canada for the 2026 Winter Olympics. After winning the Stanley Cup, he is eager to represent his nation. Montour missed the 4 Nations roster but is determined to prove his worth. He attended Canada‚Äôs Olympic orientation camp. He hopes to play alongside Sidney Crosby and Connor McDavid.

title: Gaming Bill: Centre to ban money-based online gaming - Key details
content: The Union Cabinet has approved a bill to regulate online real-money gaming platforms, addressing concerns about gambling, addiction, and inconsistent state regulations. The bill seeks to establish a uniform legal framework, criminalize online betting, and impose strict penalties on offenders, while differentiating real-money gaming from eSports and social online games.

title: 'Divorce' looms between Micah Parsons and Cowboys; contract dispute heats up
content: The contract negotiations between Micah Parsons and the Dallas Cowboys have stalled, leading to speculation about Parsons' future with the team. NFL insider Adam Schefter suggests a potential "divorce" is looming due to the lack of progress and personal complications. This raises the possibility that Parsons may seek a fresh start elsewhere if no agreement is reached.

title: Asia Cup: 'Sanju Samson will sit out' - Former India batter makes bold claim
content: Aakash Chopra suggests Shubman Gill's inclusion likely sidelines Sanju Samson for the Asia Cup, with selectors prioritizing batting slots. While Agarkar emphasizes the captain and coach will decide the final XI, Suryakumar Yadav praised Jitesh Sharma's growth, potentially favoring him. Samson's place in the playing XI remains uncertain despite his squad inclusion, creating a nervous wait.

title: Big ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô boost! IAF to get 97 LCA Mark 1A fighter jets; details here
content: India has approved the acquisition of 97 LCA Mark 1A fighter aircraft for the Indian Air Force, boosting the 'Make in India' initiative. This follows an earlier order of 83 aircraft and aims to replace the MiG-21 fleet.

title: NCERT releases special module on Operation Sindoor
content: NCERT introduced a module on Operation Sindoor for classes 3-12. The module describes Operation Sindoor as "not just a military operation but a promise to protect peace and honour the lives lost."

title: 'To deepen all-weather partnership': Chinese FM wraps up India visit; heads to Pak next
content: Following his Delhi visit, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi is heading to Pakistan for strategic talks, highlighting the enduring China-Pakistan alliance amidst growing US-Pakistan engagement. In Delhi, Wang met PM Modi, emphasizing border peace and fair resolution. China aims to maintain friendly ties with both India and Pakistan, hoping for solutions to their issues and offering constructive support.

title: Zelenskyy unleashes thank-o-meter diplomacy on second visit to Oval Office - here's why
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked Donald Trump repeatedly during a White House visit. This came after criticism for not showing enough appreciation previously. Zelenskyy also thanked European leaders for their support. Trump reciprocated with his own expressions of gratitude.

title: 'Train overcrowded': Monorail breaks down, stuck between 2 stations; all passengers rescued
content: Mumbai's Monorail experienced a breakdown between Chembur and Bhakti Park stations amidst heavy rains, stranding approximately 200 passengers. Chief Minister Fadnavis assured a safe evacuation and ordered an inquiry into the incident. Overcrowding due to suspended local train services exacerbated the situation, prompting rescue operations by various agencies to ensure passenger safety and medical assistance.

title: When 1 MiG beat 4 US fighter jets: IAF jet prepares for touchdown after 6-decade service
content: Air Marshal Prithvi Singh Brar recounts his experiences flying the MiG-21, highlighting its crucial role in the 1971 Indo-Pak War and its significance as a training platform for generations of IAF pilots. Despite its eventual 'flying coffin' tag, Brar remembers the MiG-21 with fondness, emphasizing its reliability and the skills it instilled in pilots.

title: India Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Key changes, inclusions, and omissions - more inside
content: India announce its 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, retaining Suryakumar Yadav as captain and promoting Shubman Gill to vice-captain. The squad sees the return of Jasprit Bumrah and includes fresh faces like Harshit Rana and Jitesh Sharma. While a strong core from the victorious England series remains, notable omissions include Mohammed Shami, Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

title: US revokes thousands of student visas over 'crimes': New legal grey zone for ‚Äòoutsiders'
content: In 2025, the Trump administration revoked over 6,000 student visas, citing alleged criminal activity and terrorism links, but the implications go deeper. The shift from conviction-based revocations to data-driven suspicion has blurred legality with perception. For many students, especially from India, China, and Iran, academic merit now coexists with heightened scrutiny, self-censorship, and conditional belonging in US academia.

title: 'Khada hoon aaj bhi wahin': Nadda mocks Rahul's 'vote chori' claim; shares video
content: BJP president JP Nadda has criticized Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" claims, sharing a video alleging it's a "scripted PR" stunt. The video features a woman retracting her complaint about missing names from the voter list. Amit Malviya also attacked Rahul after a psephologist admitted to incorrect voter data, demanding an apology for targeting the Election Commission.

title: Into the storm: US Air Force plane flies straight into eye of Hurricane Erin - watch
content: The US Air Force captured dramatic footage flying into Hurricane Erin's eye, revealing a calm center amidst the storm. Erin rapidly intensified from a Category 1 to a Category 5 hurricane, shocking forecasters. While currently far from land, its path is monitored due to potential shifts, with coastal regions urged to stay alert for possible impacts.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Ajit Agarkar finally reveals why Gill gets vice-captaincy ‚Äì details inside
content: Ajit Agarkar explained the Asia Cup 2025 squad selection. Shreyas Iyer will miss out due to squad composition. Shubman Gill is the vice-captain, replacing Axar Patel. Gill's performance in England impressed selectors. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team. Abhishek Sharma's bowling ability secured his place over Yashasvi Jaiswal. The Asia Cup 2025 will start on September 9 in the UAE.

title: What Mumbai rains did to city - 10 videos that show havoc
content: Maharashtra is grappling with severe flooding due to incessant rains, claiming at least six lives and displacing hundreds. Mumbai and other districts are on high alert as the IMD forecasts more intense rainfall. Authorities are evacuating vulnerable areas, with the NDRF and Army assisting in rescue operations. Farmland is submerged, and infrastructure is severely damaged, disrupting connectivity across the state.
